name: Holiday Inn Portland By The Bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel charges $10. extra for a king bed, most of the rooms come with either a queen or two double beds, we had 3 rooms so we got to see the queen and double and our queen was rather small if that's possible, bedspread kinda wrinkled from use, and the AC /heater made a loud racket making it difficult to hear the tv etc. you could turn off the fan but then it got stuffy.They didn't budge with a complimentary upgrade despite us being priority club members and getting 3 rooms for two days.The rooms were small but good and clean, except for the long hair in our tub. The pool was beautiful but cold we couldn't get in, and the sauna alas was in the bathrooms one in men and one in women so we didnt use it cause we were a mixed group and wanted to hang out together. We did get the bay view and as per the reviews I couldn't understand why people said not so great, this is the story: in the foreground is the hotel flat roof with large AC units, then small row houses, buildings, then the bay with scattered construction cranes and beyond the bay more land, not what we expected. But of course that's just ascetics, Portland is apparently an old town. The workers were all very friendly except for one girl who sassed me needlessly when I asked about the free coupon for coffee we were given. There are security guards who are very present and helpful. The restaurant Port of Call was pretty and the food was not super expensive but not cheap, baked lobster was ok a bit of dry topping but not bad. The drinks are awfully weak and we sent a lot of money on them. We went to cracker barrel for breakfast 9 mins away, didn't eat at hotel. If you forget any toiletries they will rush it upstairs to you and that was nice. My friends wanted me to give this hotel a bad review because they were disappointed with some aspects. We probably won't choose this one again if we came back to Portland, there are nice ones in the area, but dont hesitate if you are stopping by for a night or two not bad.
reviews.title: Was not what we expected but not bad

reviews.text: Lovely rooms, delightful staff - outstanding location. You can never go wrong with a Lafayette Hotel! Great location for walking in the city - we were there for business and pleasure. Enjoyed a nightcap with a very charming bartender - enjoyed the room very much. Breakfast was convenient to have downstairs
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: Carla
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.text: Had never been to Maine before and stayed here for a family members wedding last weekend and couldn't have been more pleased!!
reviews.title: Beautiful View! Beautiful Price! Beautiful Service! Perfect Location!

reviews.text: Very nicely done. I had business in Portland and made reservations here with some trepidation being that it was right downtown. Portland is allot nicer thn I thought, frankly and this property is in a very safe and secure area besides. Nice and plentiful underground parking. My space was steps from the elevator. Front desk staff very accommodating. This was a very short visit, into town at 8pm, out and back to Arizona the next day. The front desk kept an accurate wake up call and the room was convient for dressing in the morning and work at night. I asked for the Priority club upgrade and was issued a fine room with a commanding view of the harbor. Very comfortable. If you do not have a priority club membership, get one. Good prices and if there is a priority club upgrade available, and there always seems to be, you get the best room for the lowest price. There are points, but I don't pay attention to that-- I like the onside perks. At this one they had a goody bag with snacks and coupons for the bar and restaurant. A very very nice job. Stay here without worry.
reviews.title: Comfortable and clean

reviews.text: my family and i travel frequently thru the months of oct thru april for our sons ice hockey, this hotel is by far the cleanest as well as up to date hotel that we have stayed in. The stafff there is very friendly and accomodating. If you like to take advantage while you r away from home, from room service then this is the best place to be as their food is excellent!! The rooms are very well kept and very cozy. they offer free coffee and hot chocolate from machines NOT form a packet in the lobby hahahah..the location of this hotel is very easy to find.we are a family of five and the rooms are very spacious specially with all of his hockey equipment. If you are going to be staying in the portland area then this would be my recommendation for you.
reviews.title: relaxation

reviews.text: So I travel for a living and have my computer, camera, passport, and numerous other valuables with me. Apparently even if you leave your 'do not disturb' sign on your door not only do the maids ignore it, but they come into your room, go through your stuff and move it around, and clean even when you DON'T want them to because its their "policy". I understand they want to make sure you're still alive and not doing, anything illegal, but why cant they just call and leave a message when you ARE in the room to let someone in to check on you like any other hotel in the country if you need service? It is absolutely rediculous that they wait until you're gone to go in to search through your stuff. I don't care that the rooms are only mediocre, even for a HI, and its downtown, I will tell everyone I come across that this place is shady and dangerous. At a 5 star place or even a crappy motel in the ghetto, you don't get treated like this.
reviews.title: If you like privacy, don't stay here

reviews.text: I'm not at all a Holiday Inn Fan. But I do like this hotel for a work layover. The rooms are clean, the television in the room is a nice flat screen and the hotel staff is very nice. Location is also very good and my room had a pretty view of the water. Work room has some ok cardio equipment. They offer free hot chocolate and coffee all day in the lobby.
reviews.title: Nice Holiday Inn

reviews.text: We stayed two night and took advantage of all the amendities. My kids loved the pool and we spent many hours there. It as clean and had plenty of chairs and towels. The views from our room on the 5th floor was amazing. We woke up just after the new snow had fallen on the city of Portland. It was just a walk acoss the street to the Portland Childrens museum. The restraunt had a great menu with reasonable prices. Kids eat for free. The Breakfast options satisfied even my little picky eaters. The staff was very helpful and freindly. The place to stay when in Portland.
reviews.title: great views and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently decided to have a mini get-a-way weekend in Portland and a friend highly recommended the Holiday Inn-and what a FANTASTIC recommendation it was!! The hotel was not only more than reasonably priced (we paid a little over $115 after taxes) for a room with a beautiful view, large bathroom, and king sized bed. The hotel offered free parking (which they let us park early-before check in, and stay in the garage the entire next day after checkout), discount drink tickets for the lounge, a shuttle service that would bring us not only to our desired location, but would also come pick us up (until 1am)!! The Holiday Inn couldn't be in a better spot- it was about a 15 minute walk down to Duck Fat (a most fantastic restaurant- that you MUST try), a 2 minute walk to the civic center (we caught a Pirates game), and a 5-10 minute walk from shopping, music venues, restaurants/bars etc. We are already planning a trip back for the summer and without question will re-book at the Holiday Inn- honestly, the hotel was spotless and recently updated, the staff was helpful and right on with their recommendations, and the pool was clean and refreshing. Upon checkout we were offered bottles of water for the ride home- seriously...how often does that happen?! I would not hesitate to highly recommend the downtown Holiday Inn to anyone!!
reviews.title: Perfect location with exceptional service!

reviews.text: the hotel, restaurant and lounge were all beautiful! ample amount of staff made it easy to ask anyone where to go, what to visit and everyone couldnt have been nicer! Dont know if ill every stay anywhere else when visiting the greater portland area!!!
reviews.title: Perfect location for a perfect long weekend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed here a couple of times cause its just a few blocks from the great restaurants and shops downtown, and right next to the excellent art museum. Holiday Inn keeps its rooms clean and comfortable but the windows are now sealed shut so the only way to get air is through the noisy heating/cooling units. Bring earplugs for a better night's sleep. Their breakfast is very good with plenty of healthy choices.
reviews.title: Great views and location but no fresh air

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night in March. The hotel is a couple of blocks from the center of downtown. Our room was big enough that we felt comfortable with 4 of us in the room. The rooms and bathrooms were clean. Front desk staff were helpful with things to do and places to eat. The pool, however, was closed during our stay and that was one of the reasons we booked here. We were told by a man at the front desk that if we had booked with them instead of hotels.com, they would have called to tell us. Didn't seem like a reasonable explanation as they would have had our email. Also, the AC in the room was loud and we had to turn it of in the middle of the night. Otherwise, besides the pool and AC, it was all good - esp. for the price.
reviews.title: clean, convenient and helpful
Excellent value
reviews.text: We stayed a night here last year with four of us in a two twin room. The room was more of a suite as it had a dining area, so as you can imagine our large group was pleased with that. Room was of a good standard and clean with comfortable beds. The location is pretty good, only a few minutes walk to most of what downtown Portland has to offer. Some interesting clientele on our Fri night though with some kind of high school party being hosted there; lots of kids sneaking about in search of a bit of excitement shall we say... Staff were friendly and helpful and free parking useful. Would stay again if in Portland for sheer value alone.
I've been staying here on and off for 20 years and it's always been a good hotel with friendly, helpful staff.
reviews.title: Keeps getting better.

reviews.text: My daughter was cheering at a tournament game and we thought a night away would be fun. This hotel was conveniently located across the street from the civic center so once we arrived in town we were able to park and walk. Great location! The staff was friendly and the rooms were very clean and well maintained. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. Thanks for a great stay!
reviews.title: Fabulous Stay!

reviews.text: This is a typical Holiday Inn, nothing fancy at all. The location is amazing. You can walk to everything Portland has to offer. So many fantastic restaurants and excellent shopping are within 10 mins. Rooms are decent. A little dated and the view is nothing to write home about. It's very nice to have a microwave and fridge in every room. O.K. workout room. Nice indoor pool for the kids. The restaurant and bar have pretty good food.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for one night recently. Booked a King non-smoking with a bay view; stayed in room 906. If you are not from around here, let's just be clear, the view isn't that great. But, I guess it beats the other side of the hotel with a view of a street. The room wasn't overly large, but adequate for the two of us. The bathroom, however, was tight with very little counter space, especially with a coffee maker sitting there. Easy fix though…moved the coffee maker. There was a fridge and microwave, as well as a flat screen TV with about 40 channels, free WiFi, a few toiletries, iron and ironing board. I have a Priority Card through Holiday Inn and received a coupon for a free beverage in the lounge as well as a coupon for 50% off another beverage. Also got a bag with bottled water, a Maine magazine, a couple of snacks and a coupon for free tea or coffee in the restaurant. Used the beverage coupons later that evening in the lounge when we came back from Old Port. Very nice vodka tonics! There is free parking on-site as well as a free shuttle that will drop off and pick up until 1am. This was convenient because we didn't walk to walk to/from Old Port in the cold. My only issue with the room…no exhaust fan in the bathroom and no extra blankets. The following morning, we had the breakfast buffet for $11.99 pp. If I had just ordered an omelet and added on veggies, meat, fruit juice, etc., it probably would have been more that $11.99. Breakfast was just average…dry eggs, overcooked French toast and stuffed pancakes. Good selection of fruit, yoghurt, breads, and pastries. I’d probably stay here again, as it was clean, quiet and reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel. Just a few blocks from Old Port.

reviews.text: We liked it here very much. My husband and my daughter stayed overnight and the room was so clean and comfortable. The public restrooms were so clean and there were vases of flowers everywhere. The hotel staff were so accommodating, including the reservation people, the restaurant staff and the shuttle driver, Michael. Very hospitable. We walked to the Old Port area as well.
reviews.title: Great stay
Close to Old Port
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at the Holiday Inn Portland, it is a few minutes walk to the Old Port (downtown area) which was our main attraction. The hotel is located between a residential area and the Old Port. The room was a decent size, the room itself was clean, bathroom could have been a little cleaner. Our room had a view of the bay but I don't think I'd pay extra for that, your main view is of the neighborhood and the roadways and then the bay beyond that.

aka: Holiday Inn Portland By The Bay Hotel
description: When you visit the historic, exciting and alluring waterfront City of Portland, why not stay in the midst of it? Award-winning hotel with elegant decor and spectacular views. Just steps away, the Old Port thrives with unique shops, diverse restaurants and a working waterfront. Turn the corner and Portland's new Arts District surrounds the Hotel with the art museum, Children's Museum, galleries and historic homes. The L.L. Bean Factory Outlet Store and Civic Center are only a block away! Jetport is 10 minutes away; courtesy vans are available. For our registered guests...free parking, large indoor pool, saunas, fitness center. Choose from Executive Rooms, Suites and Double/Double Rooms. For your meetings and conventions, let us show you our 14,510 sq. ft. of meeting space and our 12,500 sq. ft. exhibit hall. Our convention coordinators will handle all of your meeting details, including spouse tours and island lobster bakes! Let us show you the pleasure of business in Maine, BY THE BAY.
